ch.no: System is a master that treats users as slaves returning results

ch.nm: System is a master that treats users as slaves returning results
And only such architecture allows to minimize total execution time by distributing tasks between users
And easier to implement functions that don't require human interaction (e.g. sending API requests)
And makes the programmer think in terms of message generation
But he should think in terms of customer conversion
And easy to implement notifications via messengers / email
System is a slave that treats users as masters requesting tasks
Each user has his own system that acts as slave to owner and master to employees
System works asynchronously by sending messages
System doesn't know whether user has started working on a task, paused working on a task, stopped working on a task
System can't send a synchronous request to the customer (a user outside of system control)
Actually, all users are outside of its control
System may not send the same messages at each iteration to available executors
We don't want to spam public channels

System may implement a check on the channel before actually sending the message (so that core system works idempotently as pure function, but the message placement algorithm deduplicates the messages)
Tasks collection is just a messaging channel
Outerface is just an interface for updating the database that also displays messages (tasks)
We want the system to be able to execute tasks in physical world, or those that are beyond API limitations (aka "execute functions that don't have API")

ch.no: System upserts all tasks, UI chooses next task by priority

But can use runtime assignment (like now)
System upserts a single task per user
System upserts all tasks, user chooses next task manually
But allows user to choose easy but unimportant tasks
System works based on triggers (insert, update, remove, timeout)
Database triggers are implemented via oplog watchers (Meteor query observers)
Timeout trigger is implemented via setInterval

Labor division between multiple executors with similar skills

Send requests-for-quotes, get estimates from agents, minimize/maximize whatever
